titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James De Lancey speech 1978.089
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-29 16:36:19 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Printed 1783 speech of James De Lancey, Lieutenant Governor of the English Province of New York from 1753 to 1760, in which he sets out instructions for the people of New York based on the wishes of King George III.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: James De Lancey (1703-1760) was the Lieutenant Governor of the English Province of New York from 1753 to 1760.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James De Lancey speech, 1783, 1978.089, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed speech of James De Lancey, in which he sets out instructions for the people of New York based on the wishes of King George III. Dated 1783.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

controlaccess.subject: Lieutenant governors -- New York (State) -- New York
controlaccess.persname: George, King of Great Britain, III
